intro: Sinoadina racemosa, commonly known as the clustered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Sinoadina racemosa is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
